title: League won't open on mac
body: I need help with my League client. My game was fine yesterday, and it was working completely fine, but today I tried opening League of Legends from the Applications, both from the launchpad screen and the folder, but the icon just pops up and down. When I right click, it only says Application not responding, Show all windows, Hide, Options (The only options are to Keep in dock, Show in Finder and Open at login) and Force Quit. I tried clicking keep in dock, and tried opening it from there, but it didn't work, and it said that it could not be opened. I'm not sure why it's doing this, but it doesn't seem to be working. Could anyone possible help?..

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=GalacticCaramel,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=ah6W8zbe,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-04-08T14:18:56.360+0000)
>
> I need help with my League client. My game was fine yesterday, and it was working completely fine, but today I tried opening League of Legends from the Applications, both from the launchpad screen and the folder, but the icon just pops up and down. When I right click, it only says Application not responding, Show all windows, Hide, Options (The only options are to Keep in dock, Show in Finder and Open at login) and Force Quit. I tried clicking keep in dock, and tried opening it from there, but it didn&#039;t work, and it said that it could not be opened. I&#039;m not sure why it&#039;s doing this, but it doesn&#039;t seem to be working. Could anyone possible help?..

Also, when I click Show All Windows, nothing comes up :(
Exact same problem, please help. Its NOT a connection issue.

exact same problem right now. post if you find a fix.

ill go through the "connection issues" guide. Edit: that seems not to be the problem though.
Same problem, reinstalled and it was fine until next time i relogged. Now back to the same problem. Connections issues guide has not worked for me

Exactly the same issue here, on a late 2011 MBP (so definitely not pre-2007)

2.8ghz Core i7 (2 cores multithreaded, so 2x2)
4gb of RAM
Intel 3000 integrated video. Game runs fine when the launcher... launches.

Works after reinstalling, but launcher does this after a moment. Seems to only happen after sleep mode.

And yes, I have done the connection troubleshoot.
I have the log files for the most recent launching attemps, if that helps.
I have the same problem!! Its so annoying I don't want to have to keep uninstalling the game to work :[

Had the same problem. Here is what riot support told me:

	
LudusBonus (Riot Games Player Support)
May 27, 11:05 PDT

No worries, I am so sorry for your loss :/ I hope your doing well!

Unfortunately, as for your game. We've learned that this is a known issue with 2007 or older macs. This is likely the cause of your issue. It seems that the new launcher is taking up too much ram on those older machines. We are working on a patch and hopefully it will come out soon so you can get back in game!

LudusBonus
Riot Games Player Support

I have a 2006 Mac Pro running el captain with 2 3.0 quad core processors and 21 Gb of ram.

I've been having the same issue on my mac too. It's not the connection. It would simply bounce up and down and then after a while it would freeze and say "application not responding" 

The latest solution I have is to do a reset on my mac but that only fixed the issue temporarily. This is legit getting really annoying.

Having the same problem and there seems to be no answer anywhere. Haven't been able to play for a couple of weeks now. -_- There is no problem with connection but something else happened as the launcher will load but when i click launch, the league of legends symbol bounces in my toolbar but then disappears and nothing happens.

When you open the patcher, it needs to connect to our patching servers to check for updates as well as download any new assets.  A network issue could be causing issues and failing to get through properly.  As a first step, my suggestion would be to use the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot.  Make sure to select the Mac box for instructions specific to your case.  I hope that helps!
